com.yworks.yfiles.view.input

Class GraphSnapContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.view.input.SnapContext
      • com.yworks.yfiles.view.input.GraphSnapContext

  • public class GraphSnapContext
extends SnapContext
    Concrete SnapContext implementation which handles snapping movement for IGraph items.

    This class provides a set of properties that determine the way snapping operations are being performed in the context of IGraphs. IPositionHandler implementations and the like can use the following idiom to retrieve instances of this class:

    See Also:
    GraphEditorInputMode, GraphEditorInputMode.getSnapContext()

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GraphSnapContext()
      Creates a new instance with default settings.

      Called by IInputMode implementations when an interactive drag is started.
      boolean isCollectingEdgeSnapLinesEnabled()
      Determines whether this instance should collect fixed snap lines for edge segments.
      boolean isCollectingNodePairCenterSnapLinesEnabled()
      Determines whether this instance will try to align the centers of adjacent nodes so that their centers are equally far away from each other.
      boolean isCollectingNodePairSegmentSnapLinesEnabled()
      Gets a value indicating whether this instance will collect pairs of adjacent nodes and add snapping logic so that moved edge segments will snap so that the distances to the adjacent nodes are equal.
      boolean isCollectingNodePairSnapLinesEnabled()
      Gets a value indicating whether this instance will collect pairs of adjacent nodes and add snapping logic so that moved nodes will snap so that the distances to the adjacent nodes are equal.
      boolean isCollectingNodeSizesEnabled()
      Determines whether this instance should collect the sizes of fixed nodes.
      boolean isCollectingNodeSnapLinesEnabled()
      Determines whether this instance should collect fixed snap lines for nodes.
      boolean isCollectingPortSnapLinesEnabled()
      Determines whether this instance should collect fixed snap lines for ports.
      boolean isSnapLineCroppingEnabled()
      Gets a value indicating whether to crop the snap lines at obstacles.
      boolean isSnappingBendAdjacentSegmentsEnabled()
      Whether this context will automatically snap the movements of bends so that the two adjacent segments become horizontally or vertically oriented.
      boolean isSnappingBendsToSnapLinesEnabled()
      Whether this context will automatically snap the bends to snap lines.
      boolean isSnappingNodesToSnapLinesEnabled()
      Whether INodeSnapResultProvider implementations should snap nodes to snap lines.
      boolean isSnappingOrthogonalMovementEnabled()
      Determines whether this context will automatically snap the movement in such a way that the overall move gesture is constrained to the horizontal or vertical axis.
      boolean isSnappingPortAdjacentSegmentsEnabled()
      Whether this context will automatically snap the movements of nodes so that the first and last segments of edges become orthogonal.
      boolean isSnappingSegmentsToSnapLinesEnabled()
      Determines whether this context will automatically snap orthogonal edge segments to snap lines.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphSnapContext

        public GraphSnapContext()
        Creates a new instance with default settings.

    • Method Detail

      • addBendToBeMoved

        public void addBendToBeMoved(MovementInfo info)
        Adds MovementInfo representing an IBend that will be considered for the next drag gesture.

        The default IHandle of an IBend calls this method in its IDragHandler.initializeDrag(IInputModeContext) method so snap results are calculated when this bend is repositioned. Custom IHandle implementations can add infos created by getMovementInfo(IBend).

        Parameters:
        info - The MovementInfo representing the bend to be moved. Can be created with getMovementInfo(IBend).

      • addCollectSnapLinesListener

        public final void addCollectSnapLinesListener(IEventHandler<CollectGraphSnapLinesEventArgs> collectSnapLinesEvent)
        Adds the given listener for the CollectSnapLines event that occurs every time this instance has been initialized to collect OrthogonalSnapLines.

        Event handlers should add snap lines to the caller using the methods provided by CollectGraphSnapLinesEventArgs.

        Parameters:
        collectSnapLinesEvent - The listener to add.
        See Also:
        removeCollectSnapLinesListener(IEventHandler)

      • addEdgeEndToBeMoved

        public void addEdgeEndToBeMoved(MovementInfo info,
                                boolean sourceEnd)
        Adds MovementInfo representing the end of an IEdge that will be considered for the next drag gesture.

        The IHandle returned by the default IEdgePortHandleProvider of an IEdge calls this method in its IDragHandler.initializeDrag(IInputModeContext) method so snap results are calculated when reparenting this edge end. Custom IHandle implementations can call getMovementInfos(IEdge) and add the first or last MovementInfo of the returned list.

        Parameters:
        info - The MovementInfo representing the edge end to be reparented. Can be created with getMovementInfos(IEdge).
        sourceEnd - true if the info represents the source end of the edge.

      • addItemToBeReshaped

        public void addItemToBeReshaped(IModelItem item)
        Adds an item which will be reshaped.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be reshaped.

      • addNodeToBeMoved

        public void addNodeToBeMoved(MovementInfo info)
        Adds MovementInfo representing an INode that will be considered for the next drag gesture.

        The default IPositionHandler of an INode calls this method in its IDragHandler.initializeDrag(IInputModeContext) method so snap results are calculated when this node is repositioned. Custom IPositionHandler implementations can add infos created by getMovementInfo(INode).

        Parameters:
        info - The MovementInfo representing the node to be moved. Can be created with getMovementInfo(INode).

      • addOrthogonalSegment

        public void addOrthogonalSegment(MovementInfo start,
                                 MovementInfo end)
        Adds an orthogonally moved segment to this context for which this instance will automatically collect SnapResults and provide a default visualization.

        This method can be called during initialization to collect orthogonal segments that should be tested against FixedSegmentSnapLines and AdditionalSnapLines.

        Parameters:
        start - The starting point of the manipulated segment.
        end - The end point of the manipulated segment.

      • addPortToBeMoved

        public void addPortToBeMoved(MovementInfo info)
        Adds MovementInfo representing an IPort that will be considered for the next drag gesture.

        The default IHandle of an IPort calls this method in its IDragHandler.initializeDrag(IInputModeContext) method so snap results are calculated for this port. Custom IHandle implementations can add infos created by getMovementInfo(IPort).

        Parameters:
        info - The MovementInfo representing the port to be moved. Can be created with getMovementInfo(IPort).

      • addSameHeightEntry

        public void addSameHeightEntry(RectD rectangle)
        Adds an entry for the same-height-snapping.

        During initialization this method can be used to register entries that can later be retrieved using the findSameHeightEntries(double, double, double) method. The rectangle will be used to obtain the height value and will also be used for the visualization of the snap result.

        Parameters:
        rectangle - The rectangle to obtain the height value from. This rectangle will be used for the snap result visualization.
        See Also:
        addSameWidthEntry(RectD)

      • addSameWidthEntry

        public void addSameWidthEntry(RectD rectangle)
        Adds an entry for the same-width-snapping.

        During initialization this method can be used to register entries that can later be retrieved using the findSameWidthEntries(double, double, double) method. The rectangle will be used to obtain the width value and will also be used for the visualization of the snap result.

        Parameters:
        rectangle - The rectangle to obtain the width value from. This rectangle will be used for the snap result visualization.
        See Also:
        addSameHeightEntry(RectD)

      • cleanUp

        protected void cleanUp()
        Disposes of all previously temporarily collected state and clears the SnapResults collection.

        Subclasses should make sure to call the base implementation as their last operation.

        Overrides:
        cleanUp in class SnapContext

      • collectFixedNodeSnapLines

        protected void collectFixedNodeSnapLines(CollectGraphSnapLinesEventArgs args)
        Collects the OrthogonalSnapLines for the nodes which are not moving.

        Delegates to the ISnapLineProvider implementation in the lookup of the INode.

      • collectFixedPortSnapLines

        protected void collectFixedPortSnapLines(CollectGraphSnapLinesEventArgs args)
        Collects the OrthogonalSnapLines for the ports which are not moving.

        Delegates to the ISnapLineProvider implementation in the lookup of the IPort.

      • collectFixedSegmentSnapLines

        protected void collectFixedSegmentSnapLines(CollectGraphSnapLinesEventArgs args)
        Collects snap lines for edge segments.

        Delegates to the ISnapLineProvider implementation in the lookup of the IEdge. This implementation should then make us of getMovementInfos(IEdge) to determine what segments are fixed.

      • collectSameSizeEntries

        protected void collectSameSizeEntries()
        Collects all node widths and heights in the collections findSameWidthEntries(double, double, double) and findSameHeightEntries(double, double, double).

        This method will only be called if CollectingNodeSizesEnabled is enabled and delegates to addSameHeightEntry(RectD) and addSameWidthEntry(RectD).

      • collectVisibleNodePairs

        protected void collectVisibleNodePairs()
        Finds pairs of nodes that are visually adjacent to create center and same distance snap lines.

      • dragInitialized

        public void dragInitialized()
        Collects a list of snap lines.

        This method has been overridden to collect the snap lines for all fixed graph elements and crop them after collection.

        Overrides:
        dragInitialized in class SnapContext
        See Also:
        onCollectSnapLines(CollectGraphSnapLinesEventArgs), isSnapLineCroppingEnabled()

      • findSameHeightEntries

        public IListEnumerable<RectD> findSameHeightEntries(double size,
                                                    double maxSize,
                                                    double minSize)
        Finds the entries (RectDs) that have been registered using the addSameHeightEntry(RectD) previously that best match the given constraints.
        Parameters:
        size - The size to find the closest set of identical sizes.
        maxSize - The maximum allowed size.
        minSize - The minimum allowed size.
        Returns:
        The set of rectangles that have been added previously using addSameHeightEntry(RectD).

      • findSameWidthEntries

        public IListEnumerable<RectD> findSameWidthEntries(double size,
                                                   double maxSize,
                                                   double minSize)
        Finds the entries (RectDs) that have been registered using the addSameWidthEntry(RectD) previously that best match the given constraints.
        Parameters:
        size - The size to find the closest set of identical sizes.
        maxSize - The maximum allowed size.
        minSize - The minimum allowed size.
        Returns:
        The set of rectangles that have been added previously using addSameWidthEntry(RectD).

      • getAdditionalSnapLines

        public final IEnumerable<OrthogonalSnapLine> getAdditionalSnapLines()
        The collection of additional OrthogonalSnapLines.

        This collection is only available if IsInitialized is true.

        Returns:
        The AdditionalSnapLines.
        See Also:
        getAdditionalSnapLines(SnapLineOrientation, SnapLineSnapTypes, RectD)

      • getAdditionalSnapLines

        public final IEnumerable<OrthogonalSnapLine> getAdditionalSnapLines(SnapLineOrientation orientation,
                                                                    SnapLineSnapTypes snapType,
                                                                    RectD area)
        Gets a subset of AdditionalSnapLines that matches the given orientation, snapType and intersects with the provided area.
        Parameters:
        orientation - The orientation of the lines to return.
        snapType - The snap type to be included.
        area - The area to test for intersection.
        Returns:
        An enumerable of the snap lines that match the provided criteria.

      • getBendGridConstraintProvider

        public final IGridConstraintProvider<IBend> getBendGridConstraintProvider()
        Gets the grid constraint provider for the IBends.
        Returns:
        The bend grid constraint provider, or null if none is set.
        See Also:
        setBendGridConstraintProvider(IGridConstraintProvider)

      • getEdgeToEdgeDistance

        public final double getEdgeToEdgeDistance()
        Gets the preferred distance between edges.

        This will influence the creation of the segment snap lines. For each orthogonally oriented fixed segment there will be snap lines on the segment itself and to both sides of the segment at the specified distance.

        The default is 0.0d which disables parallel snap lines.

        Returns:
        The EdgeToEdgeDistance.
        See Also:
        setEdgeToEdgeDistance(double)

      • getFixedNodes

        protected final Collection<INode> getFixedNodes()
        Gets the nodes that stay fixed for the current edit.
        Returns:
        The fixed nodes.

      • getFixedNodeSnapLines

        public final IEnumerable<OrthogonalSnapLine> getFixedNodeSnapLines()
        The collection of OrthogonalSnapLines for fixed nodes.

        This collection is only available if IsInitialized is true.

        Returns:
        The FixedNodeSnapLines.
        See Also:
        getFixedNodeSnapLines(SnapLineOrientation, SnapLineSnapTypes, RectD)

      • getFixedNodeSnapLines

        public final IEnumerable<OrthogonalSnapLine> getFixedNodeSnapLines(SnapLineOrientation orientation,
                                                                   SnapLineSnapTypes snapType,
                                                                   RectD area)
        Gets a subset of FixedNodeSnapLines that matches the given orientation, snapType and intersects with the provided area.
        Parameters:
        orientation - The orientation of the lines to return.
        snapType - The snap type to be included.
        area - The area to test for intersection.
        Returns:
        An enumerable of the snap lines that match the provided criteria.

        public final IEnumerable<OrthogonalSnapLine> getFixedPortSnapLines()

        Returns:
        The FixedPortSnapLines.
        See Also:
        getFixedPortSnapLines(SnapLineOrientation, SnapLineSnapTypes, RectD)

      • getGridSnapDistance

        public final double getGridSnapDistance()
        Gets the GridSnapDistance.

        The maximum distance between the current mouse coordinates and the coordinates to which the mouse will snap. The distance is interpreted in view coordinates.

        Returns:
        The GridSnapDistance.
        See Also:
        setGridSnapDistance(double)

      • getGridSnapType

        public final GridSnapTypes getGridSnapType()
        Gets the type of the grid snapping that should be performed.

        Determines which grid elements an object should snap to.

        Returns:
        The GridSnapType.
        See Also:
        getNodeGridConstraintProvider(), getBendGridConstraintProvider(), getPortGridConstraintProvider(), setGridSnapType(GridSnapTypes)

      • getMovementInfo

        public MovementInfo getMovementInfo(IBend bend)
        Gets the movement info for the given bend.

        This is either the info passed to addBendToBeMoved(MovementInfo) or a dynamically created instance if no specific one had been registered.

        Parameters:
        bend - The bend to obtain the info for.
        Returns:
        An instance of MovementInfo that describes the movement of the bend.

      • getMovementInfo

        public MovementInfo getMovementInfo(INode node)
        Gets the movement info for the given node.

        This is either the info passed to addNodeToBeMoved(MovementInfo) or another, dynamically created instance, if no specific one had been registered.

        Parameters:
        node - The node to obtain the info for.
        Returns:
        An instance of MovementInfo that describes the movement of the node.

      • getMovementInfo

        public MovementInfo getMovementInfo(IPort port)
        Gets the movement info for the given port.

        This is either the info passed to addNodeToBeMoved(MovementInfo) or another, dynamically created instance, if no specific one had been registered.

        Parameters:
        port - The port to obtain the info for.
        Returns:
        An instance of MovementInfo that describes the movement of the port.

      • getMovementInfos

        public IListEnumerable<MovementInfo> getMovementInfos(IEdge edge)
        Gets the movement information for the provided edge.

        The result describes the shape of the edge and the reshaping behavior of the geometry. The first element in the enumerable is the source end of the edge, followed by bend like elements and the target side. Note that it cannot in general be assumed MovedItem of the first and last element is either a IPort or IEdge, also items in between may not necessarily be bound to IBends and therefore their MovedItem can be of a different type than IBend.

        Parameters:
        edge - The edge to obtain the movement information of.
        Returns:
        An IListEnumerable of MovementInfos items that describe the geometry of the edge being modified.

      • getNodeGridConstraintProvider

        public final IGridConstraintProvider<INode> getNodeGridConstraintProvider()
        Gets the grid constraint provider for the INodes.
        Returns:
        The node grid constraint provider, or null if none is set.
        See Also:
        setNodeGridConstraintProvider(IGridConstraintProvider)

      • getNodeToEdgeDistance

        public final double getNodeToEdgeDistance()
        The preferred distance between node borders and edge segments. T

        This will influence the creation of the node snap lines. For each fixed node there will be snap lines on the borders of the node itself and around the node at the specified distance to which orthogonal edge segments can snap.

        The default is -1.0d which disables distant snap lines around the nodes for edge segments.

        Returns:
        The NodeToEdgeDistance.
        See Also:
        setNodeToEdgeDistance(double)

      • getNodeToNodeDistance

        public final double getNodeToNodeDistance()
        The preferred distance between node borders.

        This will influence the creation of the node snap lines. For each fixed node there will be snap lines on the borders of the node itself and around the node at the specified distance.

        The default is 0.0d which disables distant snap lines around the nodes.

        Returns:
        The NodeToNodeDistance.
        See Also:
        setNodeToNodeDistance(double)

      • getPortGridConstraintProvider

        public final IGridConstraintProvider<IPort> getPortGridConstraintProvider()
        Gets the grid constraint provider for the IPorts.
        Returns:
        The port grid constraint provider, or null if none is set.
        See Also:
        setPortGridConstraintProvider(IGridConstraintProvider)

      • getSnapLineExtension

        public final double getSnapLineExtension()
        Gets the amount by which snap lines that are induced by existing edge segments and node borders are being extended.

        The default is 40.0d, this value will be used to extend the ends of the snap lines.

        Returns:
        The SnapLineExtension.
        See Also:
        setSnapLineExtension(double)

      • initializeDrag

        public void initializeDrag(IInputModeContext context,
                           PointD originalLocation)
        Called by IInputMode implementations when an interactive drag is started.

        Initializes the list of nodes to be moved. Called by the wrapping position handler on initialization of a drag action.

        Overrides:
        initializeDrag in class SnapContext
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this context is already initialized.
        Parameters:
        context - The context in which the interactive drag is started.
        originalLocation - The original location of the mouse.

      • isCollectingEdgeSnapLinesEnabled

        public final boolean isCollectingEdgeSnapLinesEnabled()
        Determines whether this instance should collect fixed snap lines for edge segments.

        The default is true.

        Returns:
        The CollectingEdgeSnapLinesEnabled.
        See Also:
        ISnapLineProvider, collectFixedSegmentSnapLines(CollectGraphSnapLinesEventArgs), setCollectingEdgeSnapLinesEnabled(boolean)

      • isCollectingNodePairCenterSnapLinesEnabled

        public final boolean isCollectingNodePairCenterSnapLinesEnabled()
        Determines whether this instance will try to align the centers of adjacent nodes so that their centers are equally far away from each other.

        Note that this will only make a difference for differently sized nodes.

        By default this feature is turned off, so that the instance will try to distribute nodes evenly, so that there is the same spacing between their borders, not between their centers.

        Returns:
        The CollectingNodePairCenterSnapLinesEnabled.
        See Also:
        setCollectingNodePairCenterSnapLinesEnabled(boolean)

      • isCollectingNodePairSegmentSnapLinesEnabled

        public final boolean isCollectingNodePairSegmentSnapLinesEnabled()
        Gets a value indicating whether this instance will collect pairs of adjacent nodes and add snapping logic so that moved edge segments will snap so that the distances to the adjacent nodes are equal.
        Returns:
        true if pairs of nodes should be collected for additional edge snap lines; false otherwise. The default is true
        See Also:
        setCollectingNodePairSegmentSnapLinesEnabled(boolean)

      • isCollectingNodePairSnapLinesEnabled

        public final boolean isCollectingNodePairSnapLinesEnabled()
        Gets a value indicating whether this instance will collect pairs of adjacent nodes and add snapping logic so that moved nodes will snap so that the distances to the adjacent nodes are equal.
        Returns:
        true if pairs of nodes should be collected for additional snap lines; false otherwise. The default is true
        See Also:
        setCollectingNodePairSnapLinesEnabled(boolean)

      • removeCollectSnapLinesListener

        public final void removeCollectSnapLinesListener(IEventHandler<CollectGraphSnapLinesEventArgs> collectSnapLinesEvent)
        Removes the given listener for the CollectSnapLines event that occurs every time this instance has been initialized to collect OrthogonalSnapLines.

        Event handlers should add snap lines to the caller using the methods provided by CollectGraphSnapLinesEventArgs.

        Parameters:
        collectSnapLinesEvent - The listener to remove.
        See Also:

      • setEdgeToEdgeDistance

        public final void setEdgeToEdgeDistance(double value)
        Sets the preferred distance between edges.

        This will influence the creation of the segment snap lines. For each orthogonally oriented fixed segment there will be snap lines on the segment itself and to both sides of the segment at the specified distance.

        The default is 0.0d which disables parallel snap lines.

        Parameters:
        value - The EdgeToEdgeDistance to set.
        See Also:
        getEdgeToEdgeDistance()

      • setGridSnapDistance

        public final void setGridSnapDistance(double value)
        Sets the GridSnapDistance.

        The maximum distance between the current mouse coordinates and the coordinates to which the mouse will snap. The distance is interpreted in view coordinates.

        Parameters:
        value - The GridSnapDistance to set.
        See Also:
        getGridSnapDistance()

      • setGridSnapType

        public final void setGridSnapType(GridSnapTypes value)
        Sets the type of the grid snapping that should be performed.

        Determines which grid elements an object should snap to.

        Parameters:
        value - The GridSnapType to set.
        See Also:
        getNodeGridConstraintProvider(), getBendGridConstraintProvider(), getPortGridConstraintProvider(), getGridSnapType()

        See Also:
        getNodeGridConstraintProvider()

      • setNodeToEdgeDistance

        public final void setNodeToEdgeDistance(double value)
        The preferred distance between node borders and edge segments. T

        This will influence the creation of the node snap lines. For each fixed node there will be snap lines on the borders of the node itself and around the node at the specified distance to which orthogonal edge segments can snap.

        The default is -1.0d which disables distant snap lines around the nodes for edge segments.

        Parameters:
        value - The NodeToEdgeDistance to set.
        See Also:
        getNodeToEdgeDistance()

      • setNodeToNodeDistance

        public final void setNodeToNodeDistance(double value)
        The preferred distance between node borders.

        This will influence the creation of the node snap lines. For each fixed node there will be snap lines on the borders of the node itself and around the node at the specified distance.

        The default is 0.0d which disables distant snap lines around the nodes.

        Parameters:
        value - The NodeToNodeDistance to set.
        See Also:
        getNodeToNodeDistance()

      • wrapContext

        public IInputModeContext wrapContext(IInputModeContext context)
        Description copied from class: SnapContext
        Helper method that wraps the given context so that a ILookup.lookup(Class) query on the wrapped context for the SnapContext type yields this instance.
        Overrides:
        wrapContext in class SnapContext
        Parameters:
        context - The context to wrap and delegate all calls to.
        Returns:
        A modified instance that yields this instance if it is queried for the SnapContext type.
